Diphenhydramine Dosage

by Erowid


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information on the "Books By Author" and "Books By Subject" categories within the Erowid online library, including links to key titles like PiHKAL, TiHKAL, and Shulgin Lab Books, along with site navigation and support options relevant to users seeking psychedelic literature and resources.

Drug: Diphenhydramine | cid: 3100
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Diphenhydramine dosage.
Erowid name: diphenhydramine
Category: PHARMS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Diphenhydramine comes in different forms. The most common are various over-the-counter antihistamines, cold remedies and sleeping aids (including Benadryl, Sominex, Sleep-Eze D and several generic brands). Brands may contain different quantities of diphenhydramine, generally in the 25-50 mg per dose-unit (pill, capsule) range, as well as a variety of other potentially dangerous drugs. It is easy to mis-calculate dosages, so be careful and check to ensure that the product does not contain other dangerous active ingredients. Diphenhydramine causes drowsiness, lethargy, and sleep even at doses recommended for anti-histamine use. The dosages below are reflective of recreational use where users take doses 4-20 times the recommended dose, stay awake, and try to enjoy the "drunken", delusional state. Note: Some internet sources equate Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) and Dimenhydrinate (Dramamine). They are actually different chemicals, with different effects and dosage ranges. The chart below


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed information on the various forms, typical dosages, and potential risks associated with recreational use of diphenhydramine, highlighting its common brands, dosage ranges, and safety warnings. It is a key section within the broader "Diphenhydramine" drug guide, emphasizing careful dosage calculation and differences from similar substances like dimenhydrinate.

Drug: Diphenhydramine | cid: 3100
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Diphenhydramine dosage.
Erowid name: diphenhydramine
Category: PHARMS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    state. Note: Some internet sources equate Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) and Dimenhydrinate (Dramamine). They are actually different chemicals, with different effects and dosage ranges. The chart below shows approximate recreational dosages for pure diphenhydramine, measured in milligrams (mg).


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt clarifies that Diphenhydramine (Benadryl) should not be confused with Dimenhydrinate (Dramamine), emphasizing their chemical differences, effects, and dosage ranges. It provides recreational dosage guidelines for pure diphenhydramine in milligrams, within the broader context of the webpage's detailed drug dosage and safety information.

Drug: Diphenhydramine | cid: 3100
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Diphenhydramine dosage.
Erowid name: diphenhydramine
Category: PHARMS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Oral Diphenhydramine Dosages (Recreational) Threshold 10 mg Light 25-150 mg Common 150-300 mg Strong 250-500 mg Heavy 400-700 LD50 (Lethal Dose*) 500 mg/kg in rats Duration : 4 - 8 hours

LD50 = dose which will kill 50% of the tested animals. It is difficult to extrapolate from animal data to human fatal doses, which would be much, much lower in this case. * LD50 of 500 mg/kg in rats from Merck: "ld50 orally in rats (Gruhzit, Fisken)".

Warnings

Acetaminophen Warning: Diphenhydramine products containing acetaminophen/paracetamol should not be used recreationally. High doses of acetaminophen can be fatal. Diphenhydramine products containing other medicines can be harmful if taken in doses above the recommended limits. Dangerous interactions can occur.

Notes

As with any powerful psychoactive substance, high doses are more likely to induce difficult experiences, negative side effects, allergic responses, etc.


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides specific recreational dosage guidelines, warnings, and safety notes for oral diphenhydramine, crucial for understanding its psychoactive effects and risks. It details dosage ranges from threshold to heavy use, explains the lethal dose in animal studies, and highlights dangers associated with combining diphenhydramine with other medications like acetaminophen, making it essential for drug safety and harm reduction within the broader Erowid reference on psychoactive substances.

Drug: Diphenhydramine | cid: 3100
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Diphenhydramine dosage.
Erowid name: diphenhydramine
Category: PHARMS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Notes

As with any powerful psychoactive substance, high doses are more likely to induce difficult experiences, negative side effects, allergic responses, etc.

Every individual reacts differently to every chemical. Know your Body - Know your Mind - Know your Substance - Know your Source. Erowid's dosage information is a summary of data gathered from users, research, and other resources and should not be construed as recommendations.  Individuals can respond differently to the same dosage.  What is safe for one can be deadly for another. Start low with new substances. Have trusted companion/guide/sitter/friend present and/or available.
